meanings.definition: Not changing or capable of being changed
meanings.sent1: The laws of physics are invariable and do not alter.
meanings.sent2: Her invariable routine included a morning walk and a cup of tea.
meanings.sent3: The cat's invariable demand for treats always makes me smile.
meanings.sent4: His love for her was as invariable as the North Star.
meanings.sent5: The invariable ticking of the clock marked the passage of time.

meanings.sent1: The invariable rain in the rainforest creates a lush environment.
meanings.sent2: His invariable loyalty to his friends is admirable.
meanings.sent3: The invariable hum of the refrigerator became a comforting sound.
meanings.sent4: The invariable smile on her face brightened up the room.
meanings.sent5: The invariable rhythm of the waves soothes the soul.
